Well, sighhhhhh, we have people in Australia (i.e., gaijin) who issue their own
"papers" with swords they sell.  It could be a complete put-up job from anywhere
in the West, desu ne???  Or a similar "operation" from anybody in Japan who
fancies themselves as "sensei"...  The advent of high resolution colour printers
(COLOUR guys) has made this so much easier.  This is all a very polite way of
saying that some people consider themselves Legends in their own Lunchtime!!!
As for us, despite papers we still should run with our instincts as to quality.

Oh, I still like the tsuba and would have it for curiosity value.  I think I
know who will end up with it (snigger snigger...)

Barry Thomas.

Gordon
